commentBody:
For OT on the NFL, each team should be guaranteed a possession. If, as in the Cardinals-Packers game, one team scores a TD on its first possession, then the other team should receive a kick off and have the opportunity to tie or win the game with a 2 point conversion. Otherwise, keep the rules the same.

Employing a shoot out with field goals is unfair to the kickers, one of whom would assume the mantle of Scott Norwood.

replies.commentBody: Just had this thought...one team scores TD on first possession and successful PAT, other team given the opportunity to score a TD and required to go for 2.
